text: The 1894 FA Cup Final was contested by Notts County and Bolton Wanderers at Goodison Park. Notts County won 4–1, with goals by James Logan (3) and Arthur Watson. Jim Cassidy scored for Bolton. Notts County became the first team from outside the top flight to win the FA Cup. ==Match details== Notts County, winning team {| width=92% | |- | | |} {| width="100%" |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |colspan="4"| |- !width="25"| !!width="25"| |- |GK || 1 ||George Toone |- |FB || 2 ||Fay Harper |- |FB || 3 ||Jack Hendry |- |HB || 4 ||Charlie Bramley |- |HB || 5 ||David Calderhead |- |HB || 6 ||Alf Shelton |- |FW || 7 ||Arthur Watson |- |FW || 8 ||Sam Donnelly |- |FW || 9 ||James Logan |- |FW || 10||Dan Bruce |- |FW || 11||Harry Daft |- |} |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center" |colspan="4"| |- !width="25"| !!width="25"| |- |GK || 1 ||John Sutcliffe |- |FB || 2 ||John Somerville |- |FB || 3 ||Di Jones |- |HB || 4 ||Alex Paton |- |HB || 5 ||Archie Hughes |- |HB || 6 ||Harry Gardiner |- |FW || 7 ||Jim Wilson |- |FW || 8 ||Robert Tannahill |- |FW || 9 ||Jim Cassidy |- |FW || 10||Joe Dickenson |- |FW || 11||Handel Bentley |} |} ==References== *Line-ups *Match report at www.fa-cupfinals.co.uk 1894 Category:1893–94 in English football Category:Notts County F.C. matches Category:Bolton Wanderers F.C. matches Category:March 1894 sports events
title: 1894 FA Cup Final
